it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.common.network.socket

Interface SocketServerCommandTarget

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SocketRemoteView

    public interface SocketServerCommandTarget
    Represents the target on which a SocketServerCommand is applied. The target is normally a SocketRemoteView which resides on the server
    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RemoteView getRemoteView()
      Returns an object which can be used as a stub for the view
      SocketServer getServer()
      Returns the server
      String getUsername()
      Returns the username of the player associated with this view.
      void notifyEvent(ViewEvent event)
      Notifies subscribed observers with given event
      void sendCommand(SocketClientCommand command)
      Sends a command to the client attached to this target, usually as a response to the execution of this command
      void setUsername(String username)
      Set the username of the remote view

    • Method Detail

      • getServer

        SocketServer getServer()
        Returns the server
        Returns:
        the server instance

      • getRemoteView

        RemoteView getRemoteView()
        Returns an object which can be used as a stub for the view
        Returns:
        an object which can be used as a stub for the view

      • notifyEvent

        void notifyEvent(ViewEvent event)
        Notifies subscribed observers with given event
        Parameters:
        event - the event to notify to observers

      • getUsername

        String getUsername()
        Returns the username of the player associated with this view. It returns null if the username has not already been set (prior to login)
        Returns:
        username of the player, if it has been set, null otherwise

      • setUsername

        void setUsername(String username)
        Set the username of the remote view
        Parameters:
        username - name of the user

      • sendCommand

        void sendCommand(SocketClientCommand command)
          throws IOException
        Sends a command to the client attached to this target, usually as a response to the execution of this command
        Parameters:
        command - the command that has to be sent
        Throws:
        IOException - if the command cannot be sent due to network problems
